item.title: Firefox address bar
item.description: - The Firefox address bar is an important feature that acts as an entry point to the internet.

item.title: Show HN: Workout.lol â€“ a web app to easily create a workout routine
item.description: - Workout.lol is a web app that makes it easy for you to create your own workout routine.

item.title: Tuition costs have risen 710% since 1983
item.description: - Tuition costs in the United States have risen by 710% since 1983, creating a significant burden of student loan debt.

item.title: Self-hosted photo & video backups directly from your mobile phone
item.description: - Immich is a self-hosted photo and video backup solution that is currently under active development.

item.title: Thunderbird 115
item.description: - Thunderbird 115, also known as Supernova 115, introduces several new features and improvements to the Thunderbird email client.

item.title: First U.S. ban on sale of cellphone location data might be coming
item.description: - The Massachusetts legislature is considering a ban on buying and selling of location data from mobile devices in the state.

item.title: New study reveals most classic video games are unavailable
item.description: - A recent study reveals that 87% of classic video games in the United States are unavailable and are considered critically endangered.

item.title: Lima: A nice way to run Linux VMs on Mac
item.description: - Lima is a software that allows Mac users to run Linux virtual machines (VMs) easily.

item.title: A Japanese factory that designs clothes on a 40-year-old computer [video]
item.description: - The post is about a Japanese factory that uses a 40-year-old computer to design clothes.

item.title: Nitter is working again
item.description: - Nitter, a popular open-source alternative to Twitter, is working again after recent updates.
